tool.name: CreateDataWorkspacesFromExcel
tool.displayname: Create Data Workspaces from Excel Spreadsheet
tool.summary:
This GP tool can simplify the creation of data workspaces by allowing their connection information to be loaded from an Excel workbook. It is particularly useful if the same workspaces need to be set up in multiple environments, or if the process needs to be repeated periodically. Both .xls and .xlsx spreadsheets are supported, as are workbooks that have been password-protected using Excel's built-in password protection.

A sample Excel workbook -- SampleDataWorkspaceWorkbook.xlsx -- is included with these tools in the "Documentation" folder. Please refer to that workbook and its "Readme" worksheet for details about the workbook/worksheet format.
tool.usage:
• The default Workflow Manager database must be set before running this tool.

  • The user running this tool must have administrative access to the Workflow Manager database.

  • The Excel workbook must follow a very particular pattern; a sample workbook is provided with these tools (under the "Documentation" folder).

  • If a data workspace with a given name exists in both the spreadsheet and the Workflow Manager database, the workspace will be skipped; it will not be re-added, have its login information updated, etc.

param.name: in_file_excelFile
param.dialogReference:
The full path to the Excel workbook containing the data workspace information.

  • The workbook must follow a particular format, as explained in the sample data workbook

  • You may use a relative or absolute path

  • The workbook may use Excel's password-protection capability, though if this is the case, you will be prompted to enter the password when the tool is executing
param.pythonReference:
The full path to the Excel workbook containing the data workspace information.

  • The workbook must follow a particular format, as explained in the sample data workbook

  • You may use a relative or absolute path

  • The workbook may use Excel's password-protection capability, though if this is the case, you will be prompted to enter the password when the tool is executing

param.name: in_string_errorBehavior
param.dialogReference:
The tool provides several different modes of operation to support various use cases:

  • FAIL_ON_ERROR- (default) In this mode, the tool fails when any problem is found connecting to any of the databases listed in the spreadsheet. Use this setting if your spreadsheet exactly matches your database configuration and your databases have already been set up.

  • IGNORE_LOGIN_ERRORS- In this mode, the tool ignores failures related to usernames & passwords. Use this setting if you opt not to include username/password information in your speadsheet, but your databases have already been set up. (NOTE: you may need to manually fix the data workspace connections through Workflow Manager in this case.)

  • IGNORE_ALL_ERRORS- In this mode, the tool ignores all connection failures. Use this setting if your databases have not yet been set up. (NOTE: you may need to manually fix the data workspace connections through Workflow Manager in this case.)
param.pythonReference:
The tool provides several different modes of operation to support various use cases:

  • FAIL_ON_ERROR- (default) In this mode, the tool fails when any problem is found connecting to any of the databases listed in the spreadsheet. Use this setting if your spreadsheet exactly matches your database configuration and your databases have already been set up.

  • IGNORE_LOGIN_ERRORS- In this mode, the tool ignores failures related to usernames & passwords. Use this setting if you opt not to include username/password information in your speadsheet, but your databases have already been set up. (NOTE: you may need to manually fix the data workspace connections through Workflow Manager in this case.)

  • IGNORE_ALL_ERRORS- In this mode, the tool ignores all connection failures. Use this setting if your databases have not yet been set up. (NOTE: you may need to manually fix the data workspace connections through Workflow Manager in this case.)

param.name: in_string_wmxDatabaseAlias
param.dialogReference: An optional parameter specifying that this tool should run on some database other than the default Workflow Manager database. If left blank, the default Workflow Manager database will be used.
param.pythonReference: An optional parameter specifying that this tool should run on some database other than the default Workflow Manager database. If left blank, the default Workflow Manager database will be used.

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This GP tool can simplify the creation of data workspaces by allowing their connection information to be loaded from an Excel workbook. It is particularly useful if the same workspaces need to be set up in multiple environments, or if the process needs to be repeated periodically. Both .xls and .xlsx spreadsheets are supported, as are workbooks that have been password-protected using Excel's built-in password protection.

A sample Excel workbook -- SampleDataWorkspaceWorkbook.xlsx -- is included with these tools in the "Documentation" folder. Please refer to that workbook and its "Readme" worksheet for details about the workbook/worksheet format.
